title: Noida dowry murder: Nikki's father alleges Vipin killed her over ‘other woman’
content: Nikki Bhati died after allegedly being set on fire by her husband and in-laws over dowry demands, prompting her father's desperate plea for justice. Following this, Nikki's husband, Vipin, was shot in the leg during an attempted escape while in police custody.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar’s resignation: Is ex-VP under 'house arrest'? Amit Shah responds
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah addressed several key issues, stating that Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation was due to health reasons, dismissing political speculation. Shah defended the proposed Constitution amendment regarding the removal of ministers jailed for serious offenses, accusing the Opposition of resisting reforms.

title: Online Gaming Bill: BCCI break ties with Dream11 - ‘will not indulge with such organisations’
content: The BCCI and Dream11 have ended their partnership following the passage of The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, which bans money-based online gaming. Dream11 has stopped all paid contests and shifted to a free-to-play model, while My11Circle has also suspended real money games. Both companies affirm their commitment to legal compliance and future updates.

title: Rajasthan: Overflowing dam creates huge crater; villages submerged, roads washed out
content: Relentless rainfall in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur has caused the Surwal Dam to overflow, leading to a massive crater and widespread flooding. Villages are submerged, forcing mass evacuations and disrupting relief efforts due to impassable roads. In Dausa, continuous rain has flooded neighborhoods and damaged infrastructure, while in Amer, a portion of the Rambagh wall collapsed, suspending elephant rides.

title: 'Sleaze chat' row: Congress suspends Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: The Congress party has suspended Rahul Mamkootathil from primary membership. This action follows sexual misconduct allegations. He had already resigned from his youth congress post. The party avoided demanding his MLA resignation to prevent a by-election in Palakkad. Rahul will not sit with UDF members in the upcoming Assembly session.

title: Google CEO reverses virtual hiring: AI cheating too widespread; returns to in-person interviews
content: Google is reintroducing in-person job interviews as CEO Sundar Pichai addresses concerns about AI-driven cheating during virtual hiring. This decision marks a shift from the remote practices adopted during the pandemic. Employees raised the issue, prompting Google to balance efficiency with the need to ensure the authenticity of the hiring process, acknowledging that competitors face similar challenges.

title: Heavy rains lash Mumbai: Extensive waterlogging triggers traffic chaos, flight delays
content: Mumbai is grappling with substantial waterlogging due to heavy rainfall since August 25, impacting areas like Sion and the Eastern Express Highway. The IMD forecasts continued showers and has issued a heavy rainfall warning for August 26-27. Commuters are advised to plan travel cautiously, while rail services currently operate smoothly, and airports face minor flight delays.

title: 'No jeans': Divya Deshmukh evokes Magnus Carlsen's viral controversy - Watch
content: India’s Divya Deshmukh sparked laughs with her “No jeans!” rule-change joke, recalling Magnus Carlsen’s 2024 dress code controversy. Carlsen famously refused to change his Corneliani jeans, was fined, and later auctioned them for $36,100. Proceeds went to Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, turning a quirky chess moment into a powerful charitable milestone.

title: ICSI CS professional programme toppers: Prashil Singh, Bhumi Vinod Mehta bag Rank 1
content: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI) announced the CS Professional Programme June 2025 results on August 25, showcasing exceptional performances under both the 2017 and 2022 syllabi. Prashil Singh secured AIR 1 in the old syllabus, while Bhumi Vinod Mehta topped the new syllabus. Candidates can now access their scorecards on the official ICSI website.

title: Meta hiring freeze: Zuckerberg halts AI recruitment; employees ‘banned’ from switching teams
content: Meta has halted AI division hiring amidst a restructuring of its "Superintelligence Lab," following a period of aggressive recruitment and high-value compensation packages. This freeze comes after significant departures of key AI personnel and investor concerns over escalating AI spending. The company aims to consolidate efforts and accelerate AI product development despite recent setbacks with its AI models.

title: 'Shouldn’t make a fuss': Shah on Constitution Amendment Bill, ex-VP Dhankhar and Rahul
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah defended the proposed Constitutional Amendment Bill, dismissing speculation around Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation due to health reasons. Shah expressed confidence that Parliament would support the bill mandating removal of ministers jailed for serious offences, accusing the Opposition of protecting their leaders.

title: Noida dowry murder horror: Cops arrest Nikki's brother-in-law, father-in-law
content: Nikki, a 26-year-old woman, was allegedly murdered by her husband, Vipin Bhati, and in-laws over dowry demands in Greater Noida. Vipin, his mother, brother-in-law, and father-in-law have been arrested in connection with the crime. Nikki's sister, also married into the family, reported the horrific abuse, including being beaten and set on fire, with her five-year-old son witnessing the brutality.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for August 25, 2025 week
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to trade with an upward bias this week, according to Motilal Oswal. Last week saw fluctuations due to easing geopolitical tensions and shifting monetary policy expectations.

title: AI and jobs: Microsoft AI CEO to workers; My central worry is many will be left behind
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman cautions that AI's rapid advancement may outpace people's ability to adapt, leading to a significant skill gap rather than widespread job losses. He urges governments, companies, and educators to prioritize reskilling programs and digital literacy.

title: 'Hanuman ji first to go to space': Anurag Thakur’s interaction with students sparks row
content: During a National Space Day event, BJP MP Anurag Thakur sparked controversy by suggesting Hanuman was the first to travel to space, contradicting the widely accepted fact that Neil Armstrong was the first person to walk on the moon.

title: ‘Reskilling is central worry’: What top Microsoft official said about AI; shares 5 career lessons
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman warns that the real threat of AI isn’t job loss but the inability to adapt quickly. His advice: reskilling, embracing collaboration, and guarding against “AI psychosis.” Success in the AI era requires resilience, digital literacy, and balance. The future belongs to professionals who thrive by learning continuously and viewing change as opportunity.

title: Shocking! Medvedev’s US Open match delayed for photographer chaos - Watch
content: Daniil Medvedev's US Open match against Benjamin Bonzi descended into chaos when a photographer's on-court intrusion caused a significant delay. The disruption, lasting over six minutes, occurred at match point for Bonzi, leading to frustration and a prolonged booing from the crowd. Medvedev capitalized on the situation, fueling his comeback after Bonzi's momentum was broken.

title: ‘I have eight kids': US tourist grabs thief by ponytail after getting pickpocketed in Venice
content: A North Carolina tourist in Venice became a victim of pickpocketing, but she bravely confronted the suspected thieves after her purse and passport were stolen. Tracking her stolen items using 'Find My Friends,' she caught one of the teenagers by the ponytail until police arrived.

title: Prince William could seek new curbs on Prince Andrew’s titles as future king - Report
content: Speculation surrounds Prince Andrew's titles as Prince William may consider further action upon becoming king, potentially seeking to remove his dukedom. Stripping the title would require an Act of Parliament, unlike restricting the HRH style, which the sovereign can adjust. Public opinion favors stripping Andrew of his titles, but any action necessitates legal processes and parliamentary involvement.

title: Delhi Metro's 1st fare hike since 2017: Minimum ticket Rs 11, maximum Rs 64
content: Commuters in the national capital will now have to pay more for their metro rides as the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has officially revised ticket fares starting Monday, August 25.

title: Surreal! Athlete completes 35km race; immediately gets surprise proposal - Watch
content: A heartwarming moment from the 2023 World Athletics Championships has resurfaced, showcasing Slovakian race walker Dominik Černý's romantic proposal to his partner, Hana Burzalová. After completing their respective races, Černý seized the opportunity near the finish line, proposing to Burzalová, who ecstatically accepted amidst cheers. Both athletes also celebrated personal bests, making the championships a truly unforgettable experience.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,900; BSE Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday on positive global cues. While Nifty50 was above 24,900, BSE Sensex was up over 200 points.

title: Amorim at Man United: 28 pts in 29 games - same as two-time relegated PL boss
content: Ruben Amorim's Manchester United tenure continues to falter after a 1-1 draw against Fulham on Sunday, extending their winless streak this season. Amorim's points tally after 29 games mirrors those of managers who faced relegation battles, intensifying pressure despite significant summer investments in attacking players like Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo.

title: 5 injured in 'arson' attack at London Indian eatery, teen among 2 in custody
content: The fire erupted around 9pm (GMT) Friday at Indian Aroma on Woodford Avenue in Gants Hill when the restaurant was packed with diners. CCTV footage showed three masked people walking in and throwing a liquid on the floor. Flames engulfed the room in seconds, sparking chaos as diners and staff tried to escape.

title: ‘Huge fireball’: Video shows large explosion after Israel strikes Yemen's capital
content: Israeli airstrikes on Yemen's Sanaa resulted in at least six fatalities and over 80 injuries, as confirmed by Houthi authorities. The strikes targeted multiple locations, including a building, an oil facility, and power stations. Israel stated the operation was a response to Houthi attacks, following a missile launch towards Israel.

title: Precedent-setting ruling: SC allows crime victims, their heirs to appeal against acquittal
content: Till now, in the case of acquittal of an accused by trial court or high court, either the state or complainant had the right to file an appeal. A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and K V Viswanathan last week extended the right to appeal against acquittal of accused to two more categories of people - those who suffered injury or losses in the crime and legal heirs of victims of the crime.

title: Cleanliness major irritant for long-distance train passengers: CAG audit
content: According to the report, bio-toilets in AC coaches were found to be in better condition than those in non-AC coaches. Passenger dissatisfaction exceeded 50% in five zones, including East Coast, Western, and Eastern Railways. In contrast, satisfaction levels crossed 90% in Northern and North Central Railways.

title: Pujara: 'Time to give the next generation a chance' – post-retirement interview
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, India's Test batting mainstay, has retired from all cricket forms after a stellar career spanning from 2010 to 2023. He emphasized creating opportunities for younger players and expressed satisfaction with his media engagements. Pujara fondly recalled his innings in Colombo, Adelaide, and double centuries in India, while acknowledging the challenges posed by Steyn, Anderson, and Cummins.

title: Stocks to buy this week: What's the outlook for Nifty?
content: Stock market recommendations: SBI Securities' Sudeep Shah recommends Apollo Tyres and Nykaa as top stock picks for the week starting August 25, 2025. Nifty faces resistance around 25050-25100, while Bank Nifty underperforms, finding support at 54900-54800.

title: 8 dead, 43 injured as truck hits tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims in Bulandshahr
content: In a tragic incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district, a truck collided with a tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims early Monday morning, resulting in the death of eight people and injuries to 43 others. The accident occurred on the Bulandshahr-Aligarh border as the pilgrims were traveling from Kasganj to Rajasthan.

title: Inside Tommy Fleetwood’s net worth and love story with wife who once rejected him
content: Tommy Fleetwood, a top-earning golfer with over $31 million from the PGA Tour and $35 million from the DP World Tour, owes much of his success to his wife, Clare. Despite a 23-year age difference and initial hesitations about mixing business with romance, Clare became Fleetwood's manager and life partner.

title: Ryan Garcia slams Raja Jackson after attack leaves Syko Stu unconscious
content: Ryan Garcia expressed outrage after Raja Jackson, son of UFC's Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, violently attacked wrestler Syko Stu at a Knokx Pro Wrestling event in California. The incident, broadcast on Kick, saw Raja deliver excessive punches to Stu, leaving him unconscious. Rampage Jackson apologized for his son's actions, citing inexperience and a recent concussion.

title: Antonio Brown reignites feud with Deion Sanders
content: Shilo Sanders' ejection for punching a player in the preseason finale led to his release by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Antonio Brown then criticized the Sanders family, questioning their NFL readiness. Deion Sanders responded with well wishes, while Shilo's future hinges on overcoming maturity concerns and demonstrating disciplined behavior to potential teams.

title: India to buy oil at 'best deal': New Delhi rejects US pressure
content: India's ambassador to Moscow asserts that India will continue to procure oil from the most advantageous sources, despite the US imposing tariffs in response to New Delhi's Russian crude imports. Vinay Kumar criticized the tariffs as unfair, emphasizing India's priority of energy security for its population.

title: Experts warn of Salmonella Dublin: Cattle-born superbug that is spreading to humans
content: Researchers have discovered that Salmonella Dublin, a superbug commonly found in cattle, is increasingly resistant to antibiotics and capable of spreading to humans through contaminated food or direct contact. This poses a significant threat, potentially leading to untreatable infections, especially in vulnerable populations. The US, a major beef and dairy producer, faces a heightened risk of a widespread health emergency.

title: Starship setback: Elon Musk’s SpaceX scrubs tenth test flight
content: SpaceX postponed Sunday's Starship test flight due to a ground systems issue, marking another setback for the giant rocket. The uncrewed test aimed to push the upper stage through trials, but past flights have faced explosions. Despite reliability concerns and pressure from analysts, SpaceX maintains its rapid testing approach, with Musk still aiming for Mars missions next year.

title: KCL thriller: Samson smashes century, but Muhammad steals show – Watch
content: In a thrilling Kerala Cricket League 2025 encounter, Muhammad Ashik's last-ball six secured a four-wicket victory for Kochi Blue Tigers over Aries Kollam Sailors. Chasing a daunting 237, Ashik's unbeaten 45 complemented Sanju Samson's explosive 121. Earlier, Vishnu Vinod (94) and Sachin Baby (91) propelled Aries Kollam Sailors to 236/5.

title: 'Vote theft': Thackerays back Rahul's claim; ask workers to be alert
content: "How did the number of voters in the state increase by 40-42 lakh? Find out who are these people who have inflated the voter's list and don't let them vote," he said, adding, "If elections are conducted in a genuine manner, it will not be possible for the governing parties to win. Especially in Maharashtra."

title: Intermittent fasting can increase the risk of heart disease, finds study: What it means
content: A recent study published in the journal Diabetes and Metabolic Syndrome suggests that the popular 16:8 intermittent fasting method may increase the risk of cardiovascular mortality. The research, analyzing data from over 19,000 adults, found that individuals with an eating window of less than 8 hours daily had a significantly higher chance of death from heart-related diseases. Read more below!

title: Drinking water projects damaged, power supply affected in Chamoli
content: The casualties till now include a 20 year-old woman, who died after debris struck a portion of her house, while an elderly man has been reported missing and is feared drowned. Officials added that rescue and restoration work was being carried out on a war-footing, with round-the-clock clearing of debris, repair of damaged infrastructure and identification of safe locations for resettlement.

title: 'War 2' box office collection: Film mints over Rs 220 crore in second weekend
content: The box office clash between 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, and Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues to captivate audiences. After an 11-day theatrical run, 'War 2' has grossed Rs 221 crore domestically, while 'Coolie' leads with over Rs 250 crore. 'War 2' saw a weekend surge, collecting Rs 6.

title: Rain havoc: Jammu records 2nd-highest single-day August rainfall in a century
content: In Jammu, at least 45 students of Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine were evacuated by State Disaster Response Force and police after floodwaters submerged the hostel complex ground floor, officials said. The rain also triggered a landslide on the Kishtwar-Padder road. The Ujh river in Kathua and the Basantar nullan in Samba were flowing above their danger levels, prompting a flood alert.

title: India sees space as the future of security: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh emphasized India's commitment to space exploration, viewing it as crucial for future economic growth, security, and human progress. He lauded the Gaganyaan mission and its IAF crew, highlighting India's achievements from lunar to Martian missions despite resource constraints.

title: SC: Reciting 'guru brahma' not enough if teachers get pittance
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the Gujarat government for underpaying contractual assistant professors, who earn significantly less than their ad hoc and regular counterparts. The court emphasized the importance of fairly compensating teachers, calling them the intellectual backbone of the nation.

title: Dream11 parts ways with BCCI as Indian cricket team’s title sponsor after real money gaming ban
content: Dream11 might not have to pay any hefty penalty as the contract with the Indian board has a specific clause about getting a waiver in case there is a government regulation in place

title: Stray dog attacks: BBMP considering whether to bring back CNVR in Bengaluru flouting AWBI guidelines
content: A major concern surrounding CNVR is post-surgery complications, such as stitches reopening and extreme fatigue

title: Dhankhar resigned for health reasons, shouldn’t make a fuss over this: Amit Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah, in an interview to ANI, dismissed Opposition’s claims that the former Vice-President has been placed under “house arrest”

title: Kerala to object to UGC’s draft curricula, alleges Hindutva bias
content: UGC’s proposals for nine undergraduate subjects have sparked widespread criticism from sections of academic community

title: IndiGo flight with Assam CM on board diverted to Agartala due to bad weather in Guwahati
content: The aircraft, later, flew to Guwahati after an improvement in the weather conditions in Guwahati, said K.C. Meena, the director of the Maharaja Bir Bikram (MBB) Airport at Agartala

title: Congress suspends Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil from primary membership amid misconduct charges
content: Senior Congress leader and former KPCC president K. Muraleedharan says onus is now on Rahul Mamkootathil to decide whether the latter should continue as MLA from Palakkad

title: Farmers begin gathering at Jantar Mantar in Delhi for ‘Kisan Mahapanchayat’
content: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha said the gathering will remain peaceful and urged farmers and supporters to participate in large numbers

title: Drones sighted near LoC in J&K’s Poonch, search operation underway
content: The officials said the drones, believed to be launched for surveillance, were seen flying very high and returned to the Pakistani side within five minutes

title: Revanth Reddy’s visit Osmania University today, marks a new chapter
content: Revanth Reddy will be the first Chief Minister to address the students on the campus after Telangana was formed.

title: Noida dowry murder case: All four arrested after brother-in-law and father-in-law held today
content: The accused, identified as Satveer Bhati (55) and Rohit Bhati (28), were arrested by Kasna Police near Sirsa Toll Chauraha following a tip-off and manual intelligence inputs, the police said

title: Farmers being sold bags of soil in the name of fertiliser in Kalaburagi, allege KRRS leaders
content: To demonstrate their allegations, farmers’ leader Mahanthagouda Nandihalli and his associates opened two fertiliser bags during the press conference and showed that they contained large amounts of dry soil

title: Shubhanshu Shukla gets rousing welcome in Lucknow
content: Shubhanshu will participate in a car parade starting from the airport, which will proceed through the Gomti Nagar Vistar Campus to G-20 Chowk

title: Unfortunate, prejudicial misinterpretation: Retired judges slam Amit Shah’s remarks on Sudershan Reddy
content: The group of 18 retired judges said that “prejudicial misinterpretation” of the top court’s verdict by a high political functionary is likely to have a chilling effect on its judges

title: Learn to play around with AI tools and get fluent, Microsoft India President advises
content: Shrugging-off a recent MIT Media Lab study raising an alarm over AI and its potential cognitive consequences and neural costs, Chandok said he believes AI boosts rather than diminishes cognitive abilities

title: Maharashtra couple dies after liver transplant surgery; notice issued to Pune hospital
content: The Sahyadri Hospital has been directed to submit all details pertaining to the transplant procedure by Monday

title: Permit to Starlink bars copying, decryption of Indian data overseas: MoS Telecom
content: Minister of State for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar said the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) granted a Unified License (UL) to Starlink Satellite Communications Private Limited after the U.S. firm agreed to the terms and conditions

title: Heavy rains lash Himachal Pradesh, schools shut in five districts
content: The local meteorological office has issued a yellow warning for heavy rain in isolated areas of two to seven districts in the state till August 30

title: TikTok ban not lifted, clarifies government sources amid reports of website being accessible
content: "Government of India has not issued any unblocking order for TikTok. Any such statement/news is false and misleading," sources clarified

title: How have deception techniques evolved? | Explained
content: What are AI-enabled X-Guard Fibre-Optic Towed Decoy systems? What are some other systems comparable to the X-Guards? How has Ukraine deployed decoys in its war against Russia? Do navies also employ countermeasures to protect warships? How has India fared with deception decoys?

title: Nine dead, 43 injured as truck hits tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr
content: Two of the deceased were children while 12 of those injured and hospitalised are below the age of 18, police said

title: Odisha man arrested for conducting delivery without medical degree, causing two deaths
content: Police said the nursing home had misled the family, assuring them it had all necessary facilities for a safe delivery

title: India will buy oil where it gets 'best deal': Indian envoy to Russia
content: Mr. Kumar said that trade between India and Russia is based on mutual interests and market factors, and added that it is done with the "overall objective of ensuring the energy security of 1.4 billion people of India"

title: JSP will organise ‘Senatho Senani’ in Visakhapatnam from August 30, says Nadendla Manohar
content: Party president Pawan Kalyan will focus completely on JSP affairs during the three-day conclave, says the PAC chairman

title: Collectors and Tahsildars told to prevent coercive collection of money for issue of certificates
content: The Commissioner of Revenue Administration has issued the directive following reports that some Tahsildars are compelling legal heir certificate applicants to contribute to the Flag Day Fund and other such funds

title: Is India underestimating the cost of dealing with invasive species?
content: In a new assessment, plants have emerged as the most economically impactful invasive species worldwide as well as as the costliest group vis-à-vis the cost of management, demanding $926.38 billion in 1960-2022. Next in line were the arthropods ($830.29 billion) and mammals ($263.35 billion)

title: Fear of another defeat in Bihar polls is haunting Rahul Gandhi: Anurag Thakur
content: Anurag Thakur said Rahul Gandhi blamed EVMs after every electoral loss and now, before the Bihar election, he is making “making baseless statements about the Election Commission of India”

title: Pratap Bhanu Mehta warns of a crisis of democratic substance in Vision 2047 lecture
content: Elaborate planning documents are inadequate if issues such as poverty, communalism, authoritarianism, and ecological devastation remain unaddressed

title: Nepal officially joins India-led International Big Cat Alliance
content: The IBCA is a multi-country, multi-agency coalition of over 90 big cat range countries and non-range countries with an interest in big cat conservation

title: Man nabbed for raping minor girl in Delhi's Bijwasan
content: The accused, a native of Baghpat in Uttar Pradesh, was allegedly in an intoxicated condition. He was apprehended on the spot and handed over to the police.

title: To reach 10% women in force, CISF set to add 2,400 personnel
content: The force aims to achieve the target of 10% representation of women and an official says structured to that effect

title: Government is a constitutional employer not a market player, it cannot use outsourcing as a means of exploitation: Supreme Court
content: Bench says public institutions cannot deny long-term ad hoc employees regularisation or basic pay parity by citing financial strain or lack of vacancies

title: ‘GST restructuring will sound the death knell to federalism’
content: States will be reduced to level of municipalities, B. Sudershan Reddy, Vice-Presidential candidate of INDIA bloc, says at meeting organised by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin and DMK alliance partners

title: Tariffs put on India to force Russia to stop war, says U.S. Vice-President Vance
content: The U.S. Vice-President says the step will “make it harder” for the Russians to get rich from their oil economy

title: Balakrishna finds place in World Book of Records, Naidu terms it historic milestone
content: His journey as lead hero for 50 years stands as a golden chapter in the Indian film history, the Chief Minister says in a post on X

title: Man arrested in Hyderabad for posting sexually explicit, communally sensitive content online
content: Accused used artificial intelligence tools to generate morphed and sexually explicit images, fusing them with religious symbols and beliefs, said police

title: 17-year-old Adivasi girl ‘gangraped’ in A.P., found abandoned near Palvancha in Telangana’s Bhadradri Kothagudem district
content: Sources said the incident occurred when the girl was heading to her parents’ home in a tribal habitation in Chinturu from her relative’s house near Konta in Chhattisgarh

title: Planetarium in Kozhikode set to go hybrid
content: A new digital projector to be introduced along side the existing one; dome, chairs to be changed as well

title: With Onam round the corner, law enforcers gear up to handle rush in Kozhikode city
content: Ongoing work on the Mananchira-Vellimadukunnu Road and restricted entry points from the National Highway are expected to increase traffic on major roads

title: Former CRPF DG Anish Dayal Singh appointed deputy NSA
content: The appointment comes alongside the Union government's approval of granting honorary ranks to retiring personnel of the central armed forces, a policy Anish Dayal Singh championed

title: 130th Constitution Amendment Bill banks on power of arrest
content: “No arrest can be made just because it is lawful for police officers to do so… The existence of the power of arrest is one thing but justification for the exercise of it is quite another,” opines Supreme Court

title: Search continues for 32 persons missing in Chishoti flash floods
content: Rajnath Singh meets injured in Jammu hospital, expresses satisfaction over prompt response of J&K administration, Army, NDRF, SDRF, police

title: Indian envoy discusses ‘fair’ trade with U.S. lawmakers amid tariff tensions
content: Mr. Kwatra highlighted India’s growing hydrocarbon purchases from the U.S. as an important component of our energy security

title: CPI veteran Suravaram Sudhakar Reddy’s body donated to Gandhi Hospital amid ‘Amar Rahe’ slogans
content: As a mark of respect, the State government organised a gun salute to the mortal remains before they were shifted to Gandhi Hospital in a procession

title: INDIA bloc will not allow Bill to disqualify jailed Ministers, says Venugopal
content: K.C. Venugopal said the Election Commission has become “a tool of the BJP”; he said the BJP government did not get a majority in 2024 and Narendra Modi became Prime Minister by “stealing election results”

title: Arrest being used as a weapon to dismiss governments, says Mallikarjun Kharge
content: “It is like running a bulldozer on democracy,” says Mr. Kharge, adding, “With these Bills, the BJP can topple Opposition governments within 30 days, it can destabilise democracy by using arrest as a weapon”.

title: Prioritise fertilizer distribution through Markfed, Chief Minister tells officials
content: Officials should maintain adequate urea stocks, prevent diversion, curb black marketing, and educate farmers on proper fertilizer usage, Naidu says

title: Need for reforms to ensure fair practices in film industry, CM tells prominent producers and directors
content: He said the government will stand by both producers and workers, stressing the need for reforms to ensure fair practices

title: Affordable healthcare is every citizen’s right, says public health expert
content: At a Praja Arogya Vedika seminar in Vijayawada, G.V.S. Murthy warns that privatisation of government medical colleges benefits corporates more than people and stressed the need for strong primary and subsidised tertiary healthcare

title: Assam CM sniffs Pakistan-linked destabilisation design
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said activists such as Harsh Mander and Prashant Bhushan, the Congress party, and the Jamaat-e-Islami-Hind were working with elements from Bangladesh and Pakistan

title: DKS colleagues join forces against him over his singing RSS’s anthem in House session
content: If singing the RSS anthem is enough for one to become the Chief Minister, MLA Channareddy and I would have sung it too, says Satish Jarkiholi

title: PM Modi to inaugurate multiple railway projects worth over ₹1,400 crore in Gujarat
content: “These projects will significantly ease travel for daily commuters, tourists and businesses, while promoting regional economic integration,” says a railway spokesperson

title: Farmer carries wife on shoulder as ambulance could not reach his house in village in Belagavi district
content: Bad roads in Nayakwasti area on the outskirts of Adahallatti village near Chikkodi blamed for the situation

title: Monsoon proving bountiful for major projects
content: Several projects getting highest flood in recent years; however, about 40% minor irrigation tanks yet to become surplus this season due to uneven spread of rains

title: Almatti outflow decreases as Krishna water level reduces
content: Some of the 18 bridge-cum-barrages that had come under river waters in Belagavi and Bagalkot districts have been thrown open for traffic

title: Women launch Chitrangana Film Society in Thrissur
content: Sara Joseph calls for a new “politics of vision” as the collective pledges free screenings, study camps, and support for women filmmakers

title: Kerala government initiates Vice-Chancellor appointments at KTU and DUK
content: The notifications call for distinguished academicians with at least 10 years of experience as a professor at a university, or 10 years in a renowned research or academic administrative organisation, along with proven academic leadership. Applicants should not have attained 61 years of age as of August 23

title: Kerala to be free of waste heaps within a year, says Minister M.B. Rajesh
content: Minister inaugurates renovated waste treatment plant at Adat. He hails role of Haritha Karma Sena in the State’s waste-free campaign

title: Final 53-man roster projections for every NFL team: What we learned in preseason Week 3
content: The NFL preseason slate is over, and teams have started making moves ahead of final roster cuts on Tuesday.

title: Bonzi survives Medvedev's meltdown, late surge
content: Daniil Medvedev and Benjamin Bonzi's match was delayed more than six minutes between points Sunday night after a photographer entered the court on match point.

title: Fleetwood wins Tour Championship, FedEx Cup
content: After many near misses, Tommy Fleetwood finally notched his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after posting a 2-under 68 to finish 18 under in the Tour Championship, three strokes ahead of Russell Henley and Patrick Cantlay at East Lake Golf Club in Atlanta.

title: Raleigh hits 48th, 49th HRs to set catcher record
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 48th and 49th home runs on Sunday against the Athletics, breaking the single-season record for catchers.

title: Had it with heckler, Ohtani hits 45th HR in win
content: A heckler next to the Los Angeles dugout spent his entire Sunday giving an earful to the visitors, including a nonstop barrage of digs and chirps at Shohei Ohtani, before the Dodgers star crushed his 45th homer in an 8-2 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: Source: U-M to name Underwood starting QB
content: True freshman Bryce Underwood is expected to be named Michigan's starting quarterback, a source confirmed to ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: Grieving Chisholm's HR helps Yankees stop skid
content: Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s two-run home run in the second inning Sunday night at Yankee Stadium gave New York its first lead against the Boston Red Sox since Thursday night's series opener, and ignited a 7-2 victory for the Yankees, who improved to 70-60.

title: Chinese Taipei wins 18th LLWS title; 1st since '96
content: Chinese Taipei won its first LLWS since 1996, although its 18 titles are the most of any country besides the United States.

title: Lynx's Collier has 32 in return from ankle injury
content: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier scored 32 points and had nine rebounds Sunday night in her return after missing the past seven games.

title: 🏈 Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Where Raleigh's catcher HR record ranks among all-time surprising power seasons
content: The Mariners slugger made long ball history. Here's how his year stacks up with other shocking breakouts.

title: Out of the seven new NFL head coaches, who's the most (and least) set up for success?
content: A lot can impact a coach's first season -- but stats can tell a big part of the story, and what could be next.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win the US Open?
content: The US Open begins Sunday, with superstars Alcaraz, Sinner and Gauff in the draw. Our experts make predictions.

title: Putting a fair price on every position in college football
content: Max Olson talked to general managers and agents from around the country to put a price tag on each position.

title: Why Delaware felt the pressure to finally jump to FBS
content: As one of two new programs to make the jump to FBS, Delaware is ready to prove itself at a higher level.

title: New season, same struggling Man United: Myriad problems exposed
content: Where are Man United struggling so far this season? Well, to start: goalkeeper, captain, midfielders, goal-scorers and more...

title: Canadian star Brooke Henderson victorious in Ontario
content: Brooke Henderson won her second CPKC Women's Open title Sunday, beating Minjee Lee by a stroke for her first victory in more than 2 1/2 years.

title: Marching bands! Big entrances! Sing-alongs! 36 of our favorite game-day traditions
content: With a new season here, we look at some of the wild, wacky, wonderful reasons we love college football.

title: Jon Rahm's team outlasts Bryson DeChambeau's in LIV final
content: Jon Rahm and Legion XIII outlasted Bryson DeChambeau and the Crushers in a playoff Sunday in the LIV Golf League team final.

title: 📉 Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: 💰 Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: ⛳ Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: NFL betting guide: Four keys to help you navigate the 2025 season, plus early picks
content: Ben Solak looks at bets to take advantage of -- and ones to avoid -- and offers his strategy and early plays for the 2025 season.

title: LeBron, KD and an unprecedented next chapter in their 20-year rivalry
content: For two decades, the two superstars have led superteams to NBA glory. Now, for the first time, they're both looking up at one -- and perhaps the best one yet.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea still working to make room for Garnacho, Simons
content: Alejandro Garnacho and Xavi Simons remain summer targets for Chelsea if they can move others out. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "Why Did He Tear Manmohan Singh's Ordinance": Amit Shah Attacks Rahul Gandhi
content: Amit Shah was speaking about Rahul Gandhi's resistance to the proposed bill to remove the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and Cabinet Ministers jailed for more than 30 days.

title: Congress Suspends MLA Rahul Mamkootathil For 6 Months Over Sexual Misconduct Allegations
content: The Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) on Monday suspended MLA Rahul Mamkootathil from the party's primary membership for six months following allegations of sexual misconduct.

title: "Should Not Stretch It": Amit Shah On Jagdeep Dhankhar's Sudden Exit
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on the first day of the monsoon session of Parliament on July 21, stating that he wanted "to prioritise health care and abide by medical advice."

title: Noida Dowry Murder: Nikki Bhati's Brother-In-Law, Father-In-Law Arrested
content: Nikki Bhati, 28, died on Thursday evening after she was assaulted and set on fire at her in-laws' home in Greater Noida.

title: UP Dowry Murder Victim Left In-Laws' Home In Feb, Panchayat Did A Patch-Up
content: Six months before she was burnt alive, 28-year-old Nikki Bhati left her in-laws' home in Greater Noida and went to live with her parents in Dadri following an assault by her husband, Vipin

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Receives Hero's Welcome In Hometown Lucknow
content: Family members of Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, along with people from across Uttar Pradesh, gathered at Lucknow Airport on Monday to welcome the astronaut after his successful historic mission to International Space Station

title: Woman Donates Liver To Husband In Pune, Both Die After Transplant Surgery
content: A woman who donated a part of her liver to her husband died days after he died following a transplant surgery, prompting the Maharashtra health department to issue a notice to a private hospital in Pune, an official said.

title: On CCTV, Man On Fire Seen Running On UK Street After Arson Attack At Indian Eatery
content: At least five people were injured in a suspected arson attack at an Indian restaurant in east London, police said Sunday.

title: Tamil Nadu Minister Flays Vijay For 'Uncle' Remark, Says Actor Lacks Political Decorum
content: Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister M R K Panneerselvam slammed actor-politician Vijay for addressing Chief Minister M K Stalin as "uncle", saying the actor lacked political decorum.

title: "Think Hanuman Ji Was 1st Space Traveller": BJP MP Anurag Thakur To Students
content: It is a fact universally acknowledged that the first person to travel to space was Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin on April 12, 1961. However, former Union Minister Anurag Thakur appears to suggest to a group of young students that it was Lord Hanuman.

title: "To Make It Harder For Russians": JD Vance On Trump's Tariffs On India
content: US President Donald Trump's punitive 50 per cent tariffs on imports from India were meant to get an "aggressive economic leverage" for forcing Russia to stop bombing Ukraine, according to American Vice President JD Vance.

title: India Will Buy Oil From Wherever It Gets "Best Deal": Indian Envoy To Russia
content: Indian companies will continue buying oil from wherever they get the "best deal", India's envoy to Russia Vinay Kumar has said, asserting that New Delhi will continue taking measures which protect its "national interest".

title: Opinion: Opinion | BJP's 10 Big Strategies To Wrest Bengal From TMC This Time
content: Despite TMC's portrayal of corruption as a "washing machine issue" - that is, selective corruption - the BJP is working to put these issues in the spotlight.

title: Delhi Metro Fare Hike: DMRC Increases Ticket Prices After 8 Years. Check Details
content: Delhi Metro Fare Hike 2025: Travelling in the Delhi Metro is set to become costlier after the DMRC hiked ticket prices by Re 1 to Rs 4 on all lines.

title: Telangana Aims for $1 Trillion Economy With Focus On Healthcare, Innovation
content: Telangana is shifting its focus from being a mere manufacturing base to a global hub for innovation in the life sciences sector, a move highlighted by Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy at the APAC BioDesign Innovation Summit 2025.

title: Accused Planned To Attack Delhi Chief Minister With Knife, Also Visited Supreme Court: Sources
content: Rajesh Sakriya, a resident of Gujarat's Rajkot, told the police that he attacked Rekha Gupta after she allegedly ignored his appeals against removing stray dogs from Delhi.

title: 8 Pilgrims Killed, Several Injured After Truck Hits Tractor-Trolley In Uttar Pradesh
content: Eight people were killed and 43 others injured when a truck rammed into a tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district in the early hours of Monday, police said.

title: 200 Booked In Kolhapur Violence Case, 31 Accused Identified
content: Police have registered a case against more than 200 people and identified 31 of them so far who were allegedly involved in violence and arson in Maharashtra's Kolhapur city two days back that left ten individuals injured, an officer said on Sunday.

title: Why Chief Justice Had To Intervene In 3 Orders By Top Court Judge
content: In less than a month, three orders passed by a bench headed by Justice Jamshed Burjor Pardiwala has caught the Supreme Court in a bind, leading Chief Justice B R Gavai to intervene in the matters.

title: UP Man Climbs Mobile Tower In 'Sholay' Style, Threatens "Girlfriend" For Marriage
content: In imagery reminiscent of a water tanker scene from the famous Bollywood film "Sholay", a man climbed atop a mobile tower at a village in Bhadohi district on Sunday and threatened to jump unless his "girlfriend" was brought to him for marriage.
